string.text: Cocoon

A small, irregularly-shaped artefact formed in gravitational anomalies. It owes its name to two different factors. For one, the exterior structure of the artefact resembles caterpillar silk. But the more interesting part lies within its utility. When close to the body, the artefact reacts every time the owner is being hit by blunt or cutting trauma, spreading a cocoon-like substance over them that protects from further damage. The protection comes at a price however, limiting the movement of the user each time Cocoon activates and the protective layer thickens.\n
Cell

An artefact formed in gravitational anomalies, likely due to intense localized magnetic fields. Its interior structure spins perpetually on its axis as long as it is not disturbed. "Cell" has one truly noteworthy to an average person property. Any very fast moving objects getting within its close proximity get partially disintegrated, releasing a hefty amount of radioactive particles in the process. Some stalkers use the artefact to their advantage, claiming that dealing with radiation sickness later beats getting hit with a bullet in the present.\n
Fountain

A common artefact formed in gravitational anomalies. Its bizarre shape makes it is very valued by collectors. Interestingly enough, there's not an insignificant amount of stalkers claiming that being in possession of this artefact helps them strike a better deal with the Zone's traders. Whether it's true or not remains to be confirmed, however the mentioned merchants would rather not speak of it.\n
Spike

A common artefact formed in gravitational anomalies, that resembles petrified wood or bone. Stalkers that dared to use it on their belts say that the artefact calms them down and helps them focus in stressful combat situations, letting them hit their enemies in vital spots. Strangely enough, they also claim that the artefact gets 'angry at them' for missing their shots, which makes most folks avoid using it, fearing a permanent Zone-induced schizophrenia.\n
Signet

An artefact that appears to be a warped metal nut. Occasionally also called an "Amulet". The latter comes from the fact that some stalkers tend to keep their "Signets" instead of selling them, saying that its presence helps them relax and regenerate after a dangerous raid into the Zone.\n
Thistle

A common artefact spawned in gravitational anomalies. Despite their prickly appearances, "Thistles" seem incapable of penetrating flesh or damaging the body in any way. Recent experiments and observations confirmed them reacting with various heavy metals - property especially visible with lead. Various medical reports of wounded stalkers and soldiers show that the bullets shot by the user of this artefact shave some of the outer material to become serrated and sharp upon entering the body, creating smaller but much heavier bleeding wounds. To make matters worse, any bullet that was recently within vicinity of a Thistle will start twitching around upon contact with iron contained in human blood, causing the wound to be painful and hard to close up for a period of time.\n
Bat

A rare and beautiful artefact, consisting of two irregularly-shaped "wings" protecting a lustrous spherical core. Does not emit radiation and is quite heavy. Experienced artefact hunters learned how to use its special ability to their advantage. Once activated and placed near another artefact, Bat will extend its "wings", grab it with them, force it into its core and then close up. Soon after that the shell will turn into dust, revealing an artefact with much stronger properties or, sometimes, a completely different one altogether.\n
Sun

A rare artefact that is very much appreciated by collectors. Its exterior shell is unremarkable, but if cracked like a geode, reveals a swirling luminous core that emits a constant source of warm yellow light. "Suns" enjoy the company of actual sunrays, giving users of this artefact a source of energy when exposed to them. In the same way, when kept away from a direct source of natural light, they grab energy from nearby living things, draining them down slowly.\n
Heart

A bizarrely-shaped artefact, whose crystalline core resembles a miniature human circulatory system. Ever since the rumours spread that the artefact is able to heal dying creatures and people, the interest in obtaining these skyrocketed, both for sale to the outside world and for ensuring your own survival inside the Zone.\n
Chain

An unusual circular artefact, not to be confused with a "Ring". Generates a strong gravitational field while nothing touches it. At first glance its weight doesn't justify the minor tiredness and pain alleviation. But those ones who devoted their lives to Vyraj and The Masters can truly realise the potential of the artefact.\n
Atom

A rare and unusual artefact that resembles the old Bohr model of an atom. Not radioactive, but does produce a small amount of heat. It is very valuable to collectors and scientists both due to its shape and its properties. Stalkers suffering from being heavily irradiated due to an unfortunate exposure, when using this artefact, suddenly seem as if they regained their youth in terms of vitality. Over time the effect diminishes, but so does the radiation residing in their bodies.\n
Beacon

A clotted mass of superdense ferrous metals. It is one of the most mysterious artefacts in the Zone as its inner workings still baffle the greatest minds in modern science. "Beacon" in its active state is able to detect whenever one living thing kills another, no matter the distance between the two, as long as the intent on murder and causality are very clear. The resulting reaction is no less mysterious - the murderer is almost instantly 'teleported' towards the place where the victim drew their last breath.\n
Knot

This artefact is occasionally formed in the extreme heat of thermal anomalies. Various legends surround it, most of them scary enough to make some stalkers avoid ever picking it up. It is known however that whoever had dared to activate a "Knot" was never able to get rid of it, as the artefact would always come back to them. Other, less reliable sources talk about superhuman abilities, hearing of voices, reckless behaviour and weird disappearances.\n
Scar

Everyone knows the saying "a sound mind in a sound body". The Zone made it take an artefact form. Back in the day stalkers used to take advantage of "Scars" to heal their wounds and explore mind-altering anomalies. Unfortunately, over time the artefact showed its more sinister side. People using Scars would behave weirdly and erratically, even more so when recovering from serious damage done to their bodies. Nowadays there are very few brave enough to attach one of these to their belt, as Zone veterans enjoy telling chilling stories about "Scar" users to rookies gathered around campfires.\n
Sandstone

An artefact sometimes formed in extreme temperature anomalies. To this day no one knows how it's possible, but "Sandstone" seems to possess some sort of intelligence that allows it to identify a user's weapon. Upon linking itself to it, the artefact will seek out an anomaly to interact with, infusing the most lethal elements with corresponding anomalous properties, making them much more damaging.\n
Sourpuss

A hollow spherical artefact resembling a transparent parchment of some sorts. Covered with a layer of film, it is pleasant to the touch. "Sourpuss" activates whenever it gets covered in warm blood, and utilising the user's energy produced from burning calories it starts excreting a stimulant that helps any bleeding wound to clot up and close much faster. This ability gained it a lot of popularity in the medical world, hence the nice price it fetches.\n
Black Angel

An artefact of anomalous minerals that has been twisted into an ominous semi-symmetrical formation. Despite emitting no heat or radiation, it can condense water vapor in nearby air into steam. The artefact seems to have some sort of defense system. When hit by an incoming bullet, it is able to detect where the shot came from and redirect the potential damage back to the person shooting.\n
Grapes

A heavy artefact sometimes found in gravitational anomalies, it resembles drops of green-tinted amber twisted together. Very recently scientists were able to confirm what was previously considered to be just another one of the Zone's hearsays - when "Grapes" find themselves nearby an ongoing digestion process of a living organism, they activate, stimulating one's metabolism to heal more effectively.\n
Miser's Skull

A light and fragile artefact consisting of interlinked strands of anomalous plant fibers. The artefact is a favourite among various scum that took residence in the Zone and is sometimes referred to as a "small Wish Granter" by them. When the user of this artefact kills someone by damaging their brain, the Zone rewards them by dropping currency around the victim. Some say it's the Zone wanting stalkers to murder each other so it gets left in peace. Others say that it wouldn't be full of riches like that if it didn't want people around.\n
Phantom Star

This artefact appears to be a plasma-like substance suspended within a striated transparent shell. Generates a weak gravitational field, making it difficult to hold still or balance. "Phantom Star" when active seems to be affecting minds of nearby living beings - its user suddenly stops being noticed until some sort of forceful interaction happens. The artefact manipulates the owner as well, preventing them from being able to engage in any sort of hostility.\n
Medal

An artefact consisting of a small hoop embedded with four triangular shapes, with a small central sphere embedded in the middle. "Medal" has successfully dodged any attempts at logically explaining its inner workings. Not only is this artefact able to tell whether the user is a part of a group, it possesses another, much more mysterious ability. Whether it manipulates objects or bodies themselves still remains to be determined, however it is a known fact that when a person using this artefact is about to get hurt, there is a non-insignificant chance that they remain unscathed, as an identical type of damage gets inflicted on someone else from that person's company instead. While such an effect might be desirable in a selfish way, it is not unheard of among stalkers and many of them might not take kindly to the fact that they are being exposed to it.\n
Moon

An artefact shaped like a lunar crescent. The exterior shell continuously generates a very dim light that seems to be stimulating the user. At night, it will make you feel rested and energetic, but reverse effect will happen during daylight.\n
Generator

This anomalous disk is not radioactive, but generates a strong, small electromagnetic field. It can easily be made to 'spin' perpetually on its axis, especially when the user is moving fast. When that happens, the energy from the artefact connects itself to nearby drained batteries and devices and, provided they still had some electric charge left in them, restores their power slowly.\n
Ball

Despite appearing as a mottled ball of dirt and rock, this artefact is unusually light and bouncy, hence its name. It is believed to be a product of electrical anomalies. When worn on the belt the artefact generates a force that can be activated to repel living creatures, for some reason excluding humans. To release said force a fast and strong movement needs to happen between the user and the target, hence why most stalkers using it resort to simply kicking various mutants. Obviously, the practice of getting this close to a Zone inhabitant is not advised. But is that going to stop you?\n
Lamp

This light, glassy artefact emits a modest amount of near-ultraviolet light. It reacts weirdly with certain radio waves, making sources of various transmissions glow. Stalkers tend to use this property to search for hidden stashes at night.\n
Tapeworm

This artefact is pure silicon dioxide, twisted into an unusual shape and color by gravitational anomalies. It would be otherwise unremarkable, except for one fact. When activated, it will send strong electric shock towards any living creature that attacks the user via direct contact, effectively stunning them for a short duration of time. And as most things in the Zone, it doesn't distinguish between who attacks the wielder of the artefact, including himself. Very valued by stalkers that hunt mutants for a living.\n
Moss

An artefact formed in electric anomalies. It has a sharp, jagged appearance but is actually quite soft and pleasing to the touch. Attached to the belt it is able to detect contents of the user's stomach. Once it recognizes any raw meat of the Zone origin within the digestive system, it will activate, using the flesh's energetic value to fuel all sorts of stimulating effects, depending on the type of creature consumed.\n
Seraphim

"Seraphim" was for the longest time considered to be nothing but a pretty bauble to be sold. That was until one veteran group of stalkers came back from a deep excursion and shared their story. According to them, at some point during their trip they got ambushed by a sniper. Their leader was taken out instantly and dropped dead with his skull split in half. While sending suppressive fire they noticed his belt lighting up and as he stood up with no sign of scratch on him, with his helmet still having obvious entry and exit holes from the sniper's bullet. They managed to retreat and find out that the "Seraphim" artefact the leader kept as his lucky charm was gone and left behind only some glowing dust. Ever since then people that heard of this story hold their "Seraphims" dear, believing that the artefact will bring them back from the dead, should the worst happen. Of course, no one so far was brave enough to test if any of it was indeed true.\n
Electron

This artefact is a product of electrical anomalies. It is extremely heavy despite its small size. It has one interesting property. It is able to combine the common electro anomalies with other electric charges it finds nearby, using the anomaly as a power source. The most fascinating part of it is that the artefact considers human body to be a battery too, converting the energy into one that can be used by human cells during physical activity. As such, despite being a painful experience, one can enjoy being tireless for a short period of time. Side effects? Well, someone has yet to report them...\n
Claw

A beautiful glass-like artefact occasionally fished out of electrostatic anomalies. When used, it seems to fill its user with a weird combination of rage and desire to attack enemies directly, reinvigorating them for doing so. There's a pretty common story associated with this artefact - of a rookie that found a "Claw" together with his friend, only for them both to get chased by a pack of hungry dogs moments after. The 'friend' shot the rookie and took off, leaving him to certain death. To everyone's surprise the betrayed stalker came back to his camp, perfectly healthy, despite his clothes being completely torn from dog bites, with only a knife to his side and the artefact hanging by his belt. What happened to the backstabber is better off not being mentioned though.\n
Dragon's eye

This artefact is sometimes formed in thermal anomalies and has the appearance of a reptile's eye. It has a very dangerous and volatile property associated with it. In some peculiar way, when the user of this artefact secures a kill, there's a small chance for a violent explosion to happen within the victim's body, killing or hurting anyone and anything nearby. The more superstitious say that it's the Zone ripping out violently the souls of fallen beings. Most just prefer to avoid using the artefact altogether because of the stories of people getting caught in such explosion at an unfortunate distance.\n
Basilisk
One of the few artefacts in the Zone which copes well with all kinds of physical influences on its owner.\n \n
Helium

A bright (literally) representative of the family of electrostatic artefacts. It gives off a gaseous substance that has a beneficial effect on the body. Due to its high efficiency, it is in large demand.\n \n
Gimlet

The bowl-shaped petals of this artefact can release a powerful stimulant vapor which can alter the balance of human hormones. Of little use to stalkers, it is very much sought after for medical research. \n \n
Eye of the Noosphere

One of the most mysterious artefacts in the Zone, the "Eye of the Noosphere" can transport its wielder back in time, even to escape death. A tight squeeze of the artefact activates its ability, creating a restoration point to go back to on activation or death. Frequent use can cause the artefact to change colour, but if discharged too frequently it may cease to function altogether. The Eye gradually restores its power over time, supposedly being fuelled by the anomalous energy of the Zone.

AAC w/ Bubble

A compound of several hollow organic formations, this artefact emits a gaseous substance that can neutralise chemical or toxic particles inside the body without harming it. Thus providing a a great level of toxic and chemical protection. 
It also has a constant temperature regardless of its surroundings. This allows it to absorb heat from its vicinity and to create a little pocket around the user which prevents the flames from damaging the body. 
Apart from that Bubble, however, possesses numerous negative properties. For example, it greatly amplifies the effects of psy-waves as well as fields produced by mutants and anomalies. This disadvantage is not to be taken lightly: some stalkers have reported that psy influence was so potent when in possession of a Bubble that they felt their heads cracking from the inside and the only thing they could do was scream in pain and run as far as they could.

AAC w/ Black Spray

Being a rare artefact, little is known about its properties and origins. 
Black Spray shares a similar shape to other sapphire-like artefacts. However, the organic nature of the stem (which shares similar properties to Pin artefacts) suggests that its formed from vascular plants under exposure to dangerous psy-fields and electromagnetic waves. 
Another unique property is the ability to delay the transmission of light that enters it. The said mysterious mechanism is applied to psy-waves surrounding the artefact as well. For this particular reason, Black Spray significantly neutralises psy interferences in a large radius. 
These beneficial properties, however, come at a price. This artefact is extremely dangerous when exposed in toxic environments as it amplifies their effect and increases their potency. When exploring toxic areas, it is hence highly recommended to keep the artefact in your backpack. 
Due to the beautiful blue aura it emits, it is highly sought after by jewellers all over the world.

AAC w/ Stone Blood

A reddish formation of compressed fossilised plants, soil and animal debris. Can partially neutralise chemical poisons by absorbing them and reducing overall toxicity level in user's bloodstream. Quite widespread and not very effective as it makes chemical burns fester. It will catch fire when exposed to open flame or even spontaneously combust. 
Another positive effect possessed by this artefact is that it accelerates clotting if worn close to the body. Although it is not recommended to keep this artefact in your possession for longer periods of time as blood clots can be hazardous to your health.

AAC w/ Bracelet

Bracelet is formed from common species of bryophytes plants under high exposure to radioactive and chemical anomalies, which explains its organic nature. 
It provides substantial protection against all types of acids by gradually increasing their pH to the level of water (pH of 7). 
When worn, the artefact is also known to slightly counter the harmful effects of psy-anomalies or psy-waves of some mutants.

AAC w/ Cell

An artefact formed in gravitational anomalies, likely due to intense localized magnetic fields. Its interior structure spins perpetually on its axis as long as it is not disturbed. "Cell" has one truly noteworthy to an average person property. Any very fast moving objects getting within its close proximity get partially disintegrated, releasing a hefty amount of radioactive particles in the process. Some stalkers use the artefact to their advantage, claiming that dealing with radiation sickness later beats getting hit with a bullet in the present.

AAC w/ Cocoon

A small, irregularly-shaped artefact formed in gravitational anomalies. It owes its name to two different factors. For one, the exterior structure of the artefact resembles caterpillar silk. But the more interesting part lies within its utility. When close to the body, the artefact reacts every time the owner is being hit by blunt or cutting trauma, spreading a cocoon-like substance over them that protects from further damage. The protection comes at a price however, limiting the movement of the user each time Cocoon activates and the protective layer thickens.

AAC w/ Compass

A very rare artefact. It's been few years since one was found. 
It can locate gaps in anomaly fields. It is believed that it can help one traverse the most complex anomaly fields completely unharmed. However, very few know how to handle it properly. 
The Compass showed few unique properties under last experiments. It can interact to moving objects, causing some to completely disappear. Or perhaps teleport? 
It also weakens the body by draining stamina and increasing bleeding rate constantly. 
Holding this artefact near the body will cause death in matter of few minutes.

It can locate gaps in anomaly fields. It is believed that it can help one traverse the most complex anomaly fields completely unharmed. However, very few know how to handle it properly. 
The Compass showed few unique properties under last experiments. It can interact to moving objects, causing some to completely disappear. Or perhaps teleport? 
It also weakens the body by draining stamina and increasing bleeding rate constantly. 
Holding this artefact near the body will cause death in matter of few minutes.

AAC w/ Crystal

This artefact is formed in anomalous zones with intense elemental activity. Actively consumes excessive heat and remains cool at all times. 
It will also protect the user against electrical currents. On the other hand, exposure to such environments makes the artefact increase the conductivity due to unknown as of now mechanism. For this reason, one is forced to weigh pros and cons of Crystal when in the vicinity of areas of high conductivity. 
This artefact is also highly sought for by jewellers outside the Zone as its inner core is not radioactive and considered to be of exceptional beauty if polished and refined. Only the first 1 cm of its outer layer emits radiation. 
It is, however, highly advised to proceed with caution when planning to bring the artefact to the market as prolonged exposure to even minimal amounts of radioactive materials can result in death of the user. Covered with very hard layer. Relatively heavy due to high density.

AAC w/ Stone Flower

This artefact resembles melted cheese interspersed with sapphire-like stones. Only yellow outer shell of the artefact appears to give off radiation and by careful processing it is possible to extract the non-radioactive blue parts for jewellery and other industrial purposes. This is due to the fact that if cleaned properly and polished, sapphire comparison becomes much more explicit: the stones are as hard and durable as this beautiful gem. This quality of theirs and their appearance make them perfect gemstones and jewellers all over the world strive to have them in stock. 
The usefulness of the artefact, however, is not limited to its industrial applications. There is scientific evidence suggesting that sapphire-like stones effectively protect from psy-waves, whereas the outer shell slightly increases resistance to toxicity. 
However, it can cause objects in its vicinity to heat up and in extreme cases to ignite along with the artefact. For this reason, it is safe to conclude that it absorbs heat and is able to convey it to other objects. 
Due to its density the weight of artefact has increased beyond normal standards, and thus it is one of the heaviest anomalous creations in the Zone.

AAC w/ Battery

The artefact is quite popular in the Zone and is valued by its residents and visitors alike for its energizing properties, although it has an adverse effect on the body when used for prolonged periods of time. 
One should take note, however, that this artefact hinders blood clotting and increases bleeding rate of open wounds. On the other hand, being a powerful resistor, it is well known for its ability to shield its user from lethal doses of electricity. 
Being an artefact of electric nature, it is well known for its ability to shield its user from lethal doses of electricity. On the contrary, it should be noted that Battery absorbs heat and is able to convey it to other objects. 
This artefact is also extremely light and very portable.

AAC w/ Shell

Shell is composed of two disk of bluish colour connected by semitransparent material of unknown nature. 
This strange artefact was considered devoid of any useful properties by many scientists for a long time. Only recently has it been discovered that it is indeed quite beneficial. 
When the artefact comes into contact with the body, it will make one feel rejuvenated and thus it increases stamina recovery. This effect has in case of some stalkers induced hyperactivity. One downside of this artefact, however, is that it reduces the number of platelets in blood, thus increasing bleeding rate. 
It provides a considerable level of psy protection and absorbs electromagnetic interference, acting as a grounding material. 
It will catch fire when exposed to open flame or even spontaneously combust. Caution must be taken when approaching heat sources with this artefact. 
Shell is extremely light and very portable.

AAC w/ Mama's Beads

Shaped like a DNA helix, Mama's Beads are created near the anomalous thermo-chemical fields. One of their most characteristic features is that they constantly pulsate, generating emissions beneficial to the human body. These emissions increase the metabolism of any living creature, accelerating coagulation and healing of wounds. The mechanism behind the effects of this artefact is still unknown. 
Mama's Beads also possess potent protective qualities: they are able to shield the body from heat by increasing its thermo-regulation. 
On the other hand, it should be noted that the presence of this artefact increases electrical conductivity, so the probability of electrocution while wearing this artefact is much higher, especially during storms and in the vicinity of electrical anomalies. 
The weight is also quite high for such a small artefact, which leads to a conclusion that is of high density.

One of their most characteristic features is that they constantly pulsate, generating emissions beneficial to the human body. These emissions increase the metabolism of any living creature, accelerating coagulation and healing of wounds. The mechanism behind the effects of this artefact is still unknown. 
Mama's Beads also possess potent protective qualities: they are able to shield the body from heat by increasing its thermo-regulation. 
On the other hand, it should be noted that the presence of this artefact increases electrical conductivity, so the probability of electrocution while wearing this artefact is much higher, especially during storms and in the vicinity of electrical anomalies. 
The weight is also quite high for such a small artefact, which leads to a conclusion that is of high density.

AAC w/ Flash

This artefact is very similar in appearance to Moonlight and resembles a plasma globe or a plasma lamp. 
Being a powerful resistor, it is well known for its ability to shield its user from lethal doses of electric or psionic energy. 
When worn, it is known to slightly counter harmful effects of psy-anomalies or psy-waves of certain mutants. Flash acts as a powerful resistor and will absorb even lethal doses of electricity. 
However, it also hinders healing process, thus caution is advised especially when wounded or bleeding. This artefact is also extremely light and very portable.

AAC w/ Moonlight

This unique elemental psio-static artefact can resonate under the influence of psy-waves. Stalkers have learned to fine-tune the artefact so that it resonates in opposite phase to the main source of emissions, thus significantly neutralizing their effects. This orb of considerable beauty also increases electrical protection by reducing conductivity in the body when exposed to high levels of electricity. 
It should be noted that Moonlight will catch fire when exposed to open flame or even spontaneously combust.

AAC w/ Sparkler

This artefact has the appearance of translucent spider webs. Just as proteinaceous spider silk, it is sticky and has properties of glue. 
It can be found most commonly in or near electro anomalies and it seems to have absorbed their certain characteristics: it is able to smooth fluctuations in electric field density and acts as a weak resistor, protecting the wearer from electricity and reducing its damaging effects. 
On the other hand, it should be noted that the presence of this artefact increases the corrosiveness of acids, leading to accelerated deterioration of equipment and higher damage to tissues of any living organism.

AAC w/ Electron

This artefact is a product of electrical anomalies. It is extremely heavy despite its small size. It has one interesting property. It is able to combine the common electro anomalies with other electric charges it finds nearby, using the anomaly as a power source. The most fascinating part of it is that the artefact considers human body to be a battery too, converting the energy into one that can be used by human cells during physical activity. As such, despite being a painful experience, one can enjoy being tireless for a short period of time. Side effects? Well, someone has yet to report them...

AAC w/ Empty

Two discs of organic origin, suspended in a mirrored state against one another. Any attempt at changing the position of one without the other is made practically impossible due to a gravitational force emerging from the empty space between the discs. As a result the artifact can be used as a crude ballistic shield. To sustain itself Empty drains energy from nearby living things and electric currents. Scientists believe that the artifact emits psionic waves and radiation as a result of its metabolic processes and experienced stalkers wear it in pair with psy resitance artifacts to counter its drain on mental health. All those mysterious properties made it a valuable trophy for artefact hunters, whether they want it for personal use or to sell it for a hefty price.

AAC w/ Eye

This artefact, which resembles the human eye, considerably increases metabolism of the body, helping wounds heal quicker. Experienced stalkers say that Eye also brings luck. Irrespective of the validity of that statement, its positive effects are indeed quite potent. 
This artefact soothes the pain and is extremely useful when treating wounds. 
When worn, it is known to slightly counter harmful effects of psy-anomalies or psy-waves of certain mutants. 
These beneficial qualities, however, come at a price. This artefact is extremely dangerous when exposed to chemical anomalies as it amplifies their toxicity and increases their potency. It is hence highly recommended to keep the artefact in your backpack, never on the body, when exploring toxic areas unless you have a death wish. 
The artefact is also known colloquially as "copper eye" as it conducts electricity and amplifies its dangerous effects in the same way as copper does.

AAC w/ Flame

This artefact forms in areas of high elemental activity. Produces powerful infrared emissions which intensify metabolic processes, healing wounds before its bearer's very eyes. 
Its healing capabilities are even stronger than in case of the Eye as stalkers in possession of this artefact are said to have survived being wounded by chimeras. Thanks to that, it has earned the reputation of a miraculous artefact. 
Many stalkers owe it their lives, and most veteran mutant hunters carry it in case they run into danger. However, it shares not only positive but also negative properties of its cousin: entering a psy-field with this artefact on the belt is suicide. It will absorb psy energy and emitting it at a considerable rate. 
Also, it is highly advised to proceed with caution when planning to bring the artefact to the market as prolonged exposure to even minimal amounts of radioactive materials can result in death of the user. 
It can also be used as a reusable medkit of sorts since it heals wounds very quickly.

AAC w/ Fireball

It is a spherical artefact made of red-coloured crystal, created in the thermal and elemental anomaly. 
It has an unique property: it has a constant temperature of 75 degrees Fahrenheit/24 degrees Celsius, regardless of its surroundings. This allows it to absorb heat from its vicinity and to create a little pocket around the user which prevents the flames from damaging the body. 
A dangerous effect of this artefact is the fact that it will increase electrical conductivity, so the probability of electrocution while wearing this artefact is much higher, especially during storms and in the vicinity of electrical anomalies.It is quite heavy due to high density of crystal-like material.

Interestingly enough, there's not an insignificant amount of stalkers claiming that being in possession of this artefact helps them strike a better deal with the Zone's traders. Whether it's true or not remains to be confirmed, however the mentioned merchants would rather not speak of it.

AAC w/ Full Empty

Full Empty is a very rare result of Empty’s interaction with other gravitational fields. It is believed that anomalous gravitational hyperactivity during an emission is able to overcome Empty’s own force field and thrust matter between the two discs. The artefact becomes very heavy due to high density of the new content that is suspended and unable to escape the centre. Scientists determined that the inside of Full Empty is very likely to be of organic origin, suggesting the possibility of mutants being pulled into the artefact and turned into a molecular mush. Rumors started spreading about stalkers themselves getting sucked inside their own Empties, probably in hopes of swindling some scared folk out of their artefacts for cheap. Besides the excessive weight, Full Empty gained an even stronger gravitational force of its own, while changing the output of negative psi waves into a positive one, together with an increased emission of radioactive particles.

AAC w/ Kolobok

A relatively rare artefact forming in chemical areas, Kolobok is highly valued for its ability to heal most kinds of wounds and stop bleeding in a matter of minutes. 
For unknown reasons, scientists are spreading rumours among stalkers that the artefact modifies bearer's genetic code, which is unproven and should be regarded as conscious attempt at monopolizing the supply of the artefact by the scientific community. This does not, however, mean that it is completely harmless. 
One drawback of this artefact is the fact that it will interact to radioactive particles, so it is best to avoid radiation fields when in possession of the artefact, especially since its negative effects are not balanced with positive ones. It will also reduce energy recovery, which is the result of its sharp needle-like appendages. The needles cause small and quickly healing wounds which bring constant pain and itch, thus reducing stamina. 
This artefact also weakens protection against heat and acids due to its high flammability. 
Lightweight and not too much of a burden to carry around.

AAC w/ Lantern

Lantern is one of the most sought-after artefacts. Many experienced artefact hunters never had a chance to look at one, let alone find it themselves. The beautiful spectacle of lights emitting from it is matched by similarly wonderful properties. A single Lantern can bring a dying person from the brink of death in a matter of minutes. Some studies reported that it can even reverse the aging processes of cells, possibly making one eternally young. That in turn made the demand and, subsequently, the prices reach absurdity in the outside world. All of that, however, doesn’t come without drawbacks. The artefact demands copious amounts of energy from its host, causing the user to be extremely exhausted even after performing the most basic exercise. It also seems to have adverse effect on bone structure – the user’s skeleton becomes unusually brittle, causing fractures to happen even from very minor injuries. As such, Lanterns should only be used when absolutely necessary, around safe environment.

AAC w/ Goldfish

Goldfish gained its name due to its looks and rarity. It is believed that the artefact is created when a very strong electrical current is met with an extreme temperature. Some stalkers try to note down lighting strikes hitting near certain anomaly fields in hopes of finding one of these, despite the method being doubted by many. Those desperate attempts are, however, justified - Goldfishes fetch a great price due to their low radiation output and ability to generate a very strong, focused, gravitational force. The most rudimentary use for such property is to lessen the strain a heavy backpack has on your back, but it’s best to avoid using it while exploring unfamiliar areas. The artefact accelerates solid objects traveling near it, making bullets, claws and shrapnels pose a much bigger threat. It also attracts radioactive particles from the air, which increases the likelihood of radiation sickness occurring. One extra thing of note is the fact that many stalkers consider the artefact to be their “lucky charm” that helps them stay calm, however that supposed property remains to be confirmed by scientific research.

AAC w/ Gravi

Gravi is formed from metallic substances exposed to prolonged gravitation. This makes it capable of sustaining an powerful anti-gravitational field, which causes it to have various properties, among others reducing weight of all objects in its close proximity. For a long time, the artefact was a mystery, and it was scientist Sakharov at Yantar who first discovered that Gravi creates a minute singularity field of anti-gravitational nature, the phenomenon which occurs in intervals of 30 minutes. 
A dangerous effect of this artefact is the fact that it will increase electrical conductivity, so the probability of electrocution while wearing this artefact is much higher, especially during storms and in the vicinity of electrical anomalies. 
Another downside is that it will increase the negative effects of psy-waves and is a potent conductor.

AAC w/ Snowflake

Also colloquially known as "Radioactive Snowflake". At first glance, this artefact resembles a white Kolobok. 
Thanks to its unique properties, the artefact can significantly increase the bearer's muscle tone, thus greatly improving stamina recovery. Due to its high radioactivity, stalkers in possession of it are sometimes jokingly referred to as "Radioactive Snowflakes". 
When faced with the decision whether to carry it on the belt during a mission, you have to carefully weigh its pros and cons: does it pay to have greater endurance and high protection against electricity at the cost of being constantly exposed to its deadly radiation? Even if you are determined to take it with you, it should be noted that it is not to be used on long excursions to the Zone. 
Snowflake, however, holds a big downside: it interacts with surrounding energy sources by absorbing and amplifying their effects. For this reason, approaching heat sources, toxic areas and psy-fields while holding this artefact is a suicide. 
It is as light as a snowflake and very easy to carry around.

AAC w/ Itcher

A formation of elemental powers. The Itcher consists of two separated layers. The surface is a hard, dense metamorphic rock with deep scars covering the entire body. Completely inactive and doesn't hold any noticeable properties. On the other hand, the soft, yellow glowing core is from unknown organic nature. It actively consumes excessive heat and remains cool at all times. 
However, it is not recommended to approach chemical and acid anomalies when in possession of the artefact as it will increase the adverse effects of acids and toxins in user's bloodstream.

AAC w/ Sourpuss

A hollow spherical artefact resembling a transparent parchment of some sorts. Covered with a layer of film, it is pleasant to the touch. "Sourpuss" activates whenever it gets covered in warm blood, and utilising the user's energy produced from burning calories it starts excreting a stimulant that helps any bleeding wound to clot up and close much faster. This ability gained it a lot of popularity in the medical world, hence the nice price it fetches.

LLMC w/ Sourpuss

A hollow spherical artefact resembling a transparent parchment of some sorts. Covered with a layer of film, it is pleasant to the touch. "Sourpuss" activates whenever it gets covered in warm blood, and utilising the user's energy produced from burning calories it starts excreting a stimulant that helps any bleeding wound to clot up and close much faster. This ability gained it a lot of popularity in the medical world, hence the nice price it fetches.

AAC w/ Claw

A beautiful glass-like artefact occasionally fished out of electrostatic anomalies. When used, it seems to fill its user with a weird combination of rage and desire to attack enemies directly, reinvigorating them for doing so. There's a pretty common story associated with this artefact - of a rookie that found a "Claw" together with his friend, only for them both to get chased by a pack of hungry dogs moments after. The 'friend' shot the rookie and took off, leaving him to certain death. To everyone's surprise the betrayed stalker came back to his camp, perfectly healthy, despite his clothes being completely torn from dog bites, with only a knife to his side and the artefact hanging by his belt. What happened to the backstabber is better off not being mentioned though.

AAC w/ Beacon

A clotted mass of superdense ferrous metals. It is one of the most mysterious artefacts in the Zone as its inner workings still baffle the greatest minds in modern science. "Beacon" in its active state is able to detect whenever one living thing kills another, no matter the distance between the two, as long as the intent on murder and causality are very clear. The resulting reaction is no less mysterious - the murderer is almost instantly 'teleported' towards the place where the victim drew their last breath.

AAC w/ Lobster Eyes

As the name suggests, this artefact has the shape of two eggs fused together. The outer surface is very thick, the high density of its formation might be the reason behind its deep colour. 
This artefact offers slightly more psy-protection than its cousin, Stone Flower. It resonates under the influence of psy-waves to some degree and absorbs the dangerous effect. 
Another positive property is the ability to consume excessive heat while remaining cool at all times. 
Due to its density of the surface, the Lobster Eyes is quite heavy.

AAC w/ Jellyfish

Jellyfish is known for being one of the first wonders ever brought to the outside world from the Zone. Despite being studied extensively by many, little is known about the nature of this common artefact. Because of its ability to affect its surroundings many call it a portable anomaly. Medusa creates a strong, fluctuating gravitational field that makes it difficult to wield and transport. On the other hand, the field itself protects the user from various physical hazards. It is advised to avoid using the artefact for too long. To create the odd, slimy secretion that covers its surface it uses moisture from nearby environment - including living creatures. The substance itself is useful for protection against thermal hazards and for cooling the body during physical strain, but has a strong psychedelic effect.

AAC w/ Meat Chunk

This artefact has soft, porous, skin-like texture and is said to be able to compress. It resembles and acts like a sponge in this regard, but reveals its special characteristics only when exposed to certain external conditions. 
Firstly, to carry the sponge metaphor further, the pores on its surface are known to absorb small amounts of toxicity from environment. 
Secondly, the artefact slightly amplifies the damaging effects of psy-fields to living organisms by absorbing psy energy and emitting it at a small rate. 
Thirdly, Meat Chunk is also known to be a conductor of electricity much like the skin of a living creature.

AAC w/ Nightstar

This glowing artefact can generate a local directed low-gravity field. Widely used by stalkers along with Gravi, a similar artefact, to increase maximum load. 
Due to its beautiful inner core it is highly sought after by jewellers all over the world, however it is best to proceed with caution as unskilled treatment can cause the artefact to explode with power sufficient to level a small building. It is thus highly advised to perform the polishing by means of specialised machinery, which minimises the probability of explosion. Moreover, only the outer core of the artefact emits radiation. 
Nightstar will also absorb toxic and chemical agents from the environment, which makes it a valuable artefact for artefact hunters, although the amount of toxicity absorbed is negligible. It is, however, relatively cheap and even stalkers with pretty tight budgets can afford it if opportunity to buy it arises. 
That being said, Nightstar emits odour of burning flesh when in the closest proximity of heat source. Prolonged exposure may enhance its flammability and cause it to ignite.

AAC w/ Heart of the Oasis

This artefact was found at the centre of the legendary Oasis. It appears that the Heart is a crystallised plant, which has acquired the healing properties of the Oasis. 
Not only it dramatically increases recovery rate of wounds and healing process, but also provides the body with strong source of energy. It is a true miracle. 
That being said, the Oasis is very sensitive to outer sources of energy and surrounding environment. For this reason, interacting with anomaly fields will bring death to the holder.

AAC w/ Pin

A small artefact formed by elemental anomalies in the Zone under extreme temperatures. The look of this artefact suggests that it was an organ of a vascular plant. Further studies showed that other organic tissues are fused deep inside. 
The stem doesn't hold any useful properties. On the contrary, the small pins reduce temperature of user's body and cool all objects in their vicinity. 
This artefact offers a slight psy-protection as it will resonate under the influence of psy-waves. On the other hand, it is not recommended to approach chemical and acid anomalies when in possession of the artefact as it will increase the adverse effects of acids and toxins in user's bloodstream.

AAC w/ Thistle

A common artefact spawned in gravitational anomalies. Despite their prickly appearances, "Thistles" seem incapable of penetrating flesh or damaging the body in any way. Recent experiments and observations confirmed them reacting with various heavy metals - property especially visible with lead. Various medical reports of wounded stalkers and soldiers show that the bullets shot by the user of this artefact shave some of the outer material to become serrated and sharp upon entering the body, creating smaller but much heavier bleeding wounds. To make matters worse, any bullet that was recently within vicinity of a Thistle will start twitching around upon contact with iron contained in human blood, causing the wound to be painful and hard to close up for a period of time.

AAC w/ Ring

A very small artefact of electric nature. Difficult to spot. Consists of two ring-shaped materials of organic nature, hence the given name. When the Ring spins, it never stops spinning, defying the first law of thermodynamics. Scientists suggest that this artefact inherits gravitational properties from Vortex anomalies. 
The outer ring has a high-conductivity. It absorbs electrical current from relative sources then ground it in the inner ring. Despite the basic function, the mechanism behind the disappearance of electrical power inside the second ring is still unknown. 
On the other side, the Ring is flammable. Prolonged exposure may enhance its flammability and cause it to ignite.

The outer ring has a high-conductivity. It absorbs electrical current from relative sources then ground it in the inner ring. Despite the basic function, the mechanism behind the disappearance of electrical power inside the second ring is still unknown. 
On the other side, the Ring is flammable. Prolonged exposure may enhance its flammability and cause it to ignite.

AAC w/ Sandstone

An artefact sometimes formed in extreme temperature anomalies. To this day no one knows how it's possible, but "Sandstone" seems to possess some sort of intelligence that allows it to identify a user's weapon. Upon linking itself to it, the artefact will seek out an anomaly to interact with, infusing the most lethal elements with corresponding anomalous properties, making them much more damaging.

AAC w/ Seraphim

"Seraphim" was for the longest time considered to be nothing but a pretty bauble to be sold. That was until one veteran group of stalkers came back from a deep excursion and shared their story. According to them, at some point during their trip they got ambushed by a sniper. Their leader was taken out instantly and dropped dead with his skull split in half. While sending suppressive fire they noticed his belt lighting up and as he stood up with no sign of scratch on him, with his helmet still having obvious entry and exit holes from the sniper's bullet. They managed to retreat and find out that the "Seraphim" artefact the leader kept as his lucky charm was gone and left behind only some glowing dust. Ever since then people that heard of this story hold their "Seraphims" dear, believing that the artefact will bring them back from the dead, should the worst happen. Of course, no one so far was brave enough to test if any of it was indeed true.

AAC w/ Signet

An artefact that appears to be a warped metal nut. Occasionally also called an "Amulet". The latter comes from the fact that some stalkers tend to keep their "Signets" instead of selling them, saying that its presence helps them relax and regenerate after a dangerous raid into the Zone.

AAC w/ Miser's Skull

A light and fragile artefact consisting of interlinked strands of anomalous plant fibers. The artefact is a favourite among various scum that took residence in the Zone and is sometimes referred to as a "small Wish Granter" by them. When the user of this artefact kills someone by damaging their brain, the Zone rewards them by dropping currency around the victim. Some say it's the Zone wanting stalkers to murder each other so it gets left in peace. Others say that it wouldn't be full of riches like that if it didn't want people around.

AAC w/ Soul

Soul is a unique organic artefact with properties just as unique: it secretes slimy goo that dramatically increases recovery rate of wounds. Thanks to its reasonable price and attractive appearance, this artefact is a valuable collector's item. 
Applying its gooey substance to wounds will soothes the pain and speeds up healing process. \It also reduces the effects of psy-waves and their damage to one's brain. But it should be known that Soul drains power from its user. The artefact does not have high density and thus is not very heavy.

AAC w/ Spike

A common artefact formed in gravitational anomalies, that resembles petrified wood or bone. Stalkers that dared to use it on their belts say that the artefact calms them down and helps them focus in stressful combat situations, letting them hit their enemies in vital spots. Strangely enough, they also claim that the artefact gets 'angry at them' for missing their shots, which makes most folks avoid using it, fearing a permanent Zone-induced schizophrenia.

AAC w/ Sponge

Sponge has always been under debate among the Ecologists. Some suggest that this artefact is driven from basic form of organisms, while others believe its an advanced life form with self-awareness inherited from living creatures. 
Despite the theories surrounding the artefact, all can agree on one thing: it moves. The sponge sometimes tries to "grab" an object it touches. Putting it in a container might be a hard task, as if it wants to escape. 
This artefact acts as a powerful resistor and will absorb even lethal doses of electricity. On the other hand, it will catch fire when exposed to open flame or even spontaneously combust.

Sponge has always been under debate among the Ecologists. Some suggest that this artefact is driven from basic form of organisms, while others believe its an advanced life form with self-awareness inherited from living creatures. 
Despite the theories surrounding the artefact, all can agree on one thing: it moves. The sponge sometimes tries to "grab" an object it touches. Putting it in a container might be a hard task, as if it wants to escape. 
This artefact acts as a powerful resistor and will absorb even lethal doses of electricity. On the other hand, it will catch fire when exposed to open flame or even spontaneously combust.

AAC w/ Phantom Star

This artefact appears to be a plasma-like substance suspended within a striated transparent shell. Generates a weak gravitational field, making it difficult to hold still or balance. "Phantom Star" when active seems to be affecting minds of nearby living beings - its user suddenly stops being noticed until some sort of forceful interaction happens. The artefact manipulates the owner as well, preventing them from being able to engage in any sort of hostility.

AAC w/ Sun

A rare artefact that is very much appreciated by collectors. Its exterior shell is unremarkable, but if cracked like a geode, reveals a swirling luminous core that emits a constant source of warm yellow light. "Suns" enjoy the company of actual sunrays, giving users of this artefact a source of energy when exposed to them. In the same way, when kept away from a direct source of natural light, they grab energy from nearby living things, draining them down slowly.

AAC w/ Tapeworm

This artefact is pure silicon dioxide, twisted into an unusual shape and color by gravitational anomalies. It would be otherwise unremarkable, except for one fact. When activated, it will send strong electric shock towards any living creature that attacks the user via direct contact, effectively stunning them for a short duration of time. And as most things in the Zone, it doesn't distinguish between who attacks the wielder of the artefact, including himself. Very valued by stalkers that hunt mutants for a living.

AAC w/ Wrenched

Wrenched is a grim reminder of what effect the Zone has on living things. Gravitational abnormalities shifted, squeezed and bent a bunch of plant roots and branches together, creating a dense, heavy, gruesome nest. But judging the book by its cover is not always good in the Zone. What the artefact lacks in looks, it makes up in its properties. Wrenched gained the ability to affect gravity themselves, creating a small protective field around the user, which helps against many physical dangers. The field also discards toxic particles around it, which stalkers take advantage of while diving into certain anomaly fields. One should remember to take the artefact off their belt before dealing with electrical currents, as Wrenched acts as a strong conductor. Reportedly the gravitational disturbances also increase the user’s blood pressure, which proves to be problematic when trying to close up bleeding wounds.
